channel.title: Food – Vamos a Bailar
channel.description: A traveling blog for discovering South America

item.title: The white city Popayan
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
The city I arrived with Guillaume at the terminal at 4am. Why so early ?! Because the bus driver was driving very fast. We took the 10pm bus and with a 8 hours journey, we would have arrived at 6am. However, the bus was rushing all way long. I realized it when I woke up […]

The post The white city Popayan appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: Loja
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
A quiet city rather simple The city is not very beautiful. Except this drawing and the gate, there is nothing else worth to see. Also, the city was really quiet. After 8:30pm, already a lot of restaurants closed. And after 10pm, almost no one left in the street. Surrounded by vegetation Hopefully, the city is […]

The post Loja appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: Bolivian specialties
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
Some of my nice culinary experiments Food Charquekan Dried beef, salt cheese, egg and white corn. Pique macho A meal with pieces of beef, fried potatoes, onion, sausage, tomatoes, peppers, spicy peppers and egg. Aji de Fideo Meal with pasta, chopped beef, vegetables Picante de Lengua Beef tongue. The “Picante” is the type of way […]

The post Bolivian specialties appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: My crush on Sucre
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
After being sick when I arrived, I continued to suffer due to the altitude. Sucre is located at 2,700 meters high. At the beginning, I got a headache and difficulties to eat. Only after three weeks of being at this altitude or higher, I could be normal again. Aside from this trouble, I was able […]

The post My crush on Sucre appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: Santa Cruz: my first contact with the Bolivian culture
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
Welcome to Bolivia I arrived by plane from Sao Paulo. This was a huge shock between the messy city of Sao Paulo and the quietness of Santa Cruz. The country is cheap as a lot of people told me. However, it is also far less developed that the other countries I have visited so far. […]

The post Santa Cruz: my first contact with the Bolivian culture appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: A stop in Cordoba on the way to Buenos Aires
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
I only stayed in Cordoba two nights during my transit from San Juan to Buenos Aires. I was looking for some Tango, but I didn’t find much about it. On top of that, it rained a lot. Thus, I didn’t visit the place as well. My first Argentinian meal: Locro My biggest surprise in Cordoba […]

The post A stop in Cordoba on the way to Buenos Aires appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: 12 specialties from the Chilean kitchen
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
Chile is not only wineries, nature or beach but also a typical kitchen. Here, I present all the typical specialties I have tried. From corn Chile is a huge producer of corn and hence the traditional kitchen uses it a lot. Pastel de Choclo A gratin made mostly with corn. It also contains chicken meat, […]

The post 12 specialties from the Chilean kitchen appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: One day in Valparaiso & Viña del Mar
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
I arrived at 8 in the morning in Santiago from Pucon. My friend took me from the terminal and we went to his home. Just the time to change me and ate a breakfast. Next, we took the car directly to Valparaiso. After one hour of driving in a dry landscape, we reached the city. […]

The post One day in Valparaiso & Viña del Mar appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: How to enjoy your stay in Santiago
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
Santiago is a huge city, almost half of the population of Chile lives there. Big, hot in summer and polluted, Santiago has a lot for frightening. However, I stayed a long time in Santiago. The main reason is that I have met a lot of friends during my last student exchange. But not only my […]

The post How to enjoy your stay in Santiago appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.
